content:
julie Bourque  Staff WriterDecember  

A sea of caps and gowns will be found in Lantz Arena Saturday while this years fall commencement takes place PERIOD



More than  Eastern students are eligible for this falls commencement but only  to  will be walking according to Julia Abell director of planning and institutional studies PERIOD

Amanda King senior media development major is both happy and sad to be one of these  students leaving Eastern PERIOD

Im excited because its a new chapter of my life but Im sad because its an ending to a chapter as well King said PERIOD

Not only the students who have met requirements for fall commencement will be participating Saturday but the students who officially graduated in August will also be participating PERIOD

Summer graduates have a choice of walking early in the previous spring ceremony or waiting until December PERIOD If students choose to walk in the spring an application must first be filled PERIOD And if accepted they may walk and not receive their diploma until the official time of graduation PERIOD

The summer commencement ceremony has been eliminated because of cost availability of volunteers and fewer students eligible PERIOD

To shorten the length of the commencement separate ceremonies will be held at  a.m PERIOD and  p.m PERIOD

Walking in the morning ceremony are graduates from the Lumpkin College of Business and Applied Sciences and the College of Arts and Humanities PERIOD Graduates from the College of Education and Professional Studies College of Sciences and School of Continuing Education will wait until the afternoon ceremony to march PERIOD

Traditionally the Student Body President Caleb Judy and Faculty Senate Chair David A PERIOD Carpenter will address the graduates at both ceremonies PERIOD

Commencement marshals who carry the university mace a symbol of honor are also a custom to Easterns ceremony PERIOD

Robert U PERIOD Fischer representing the Graduate School and Eugene Harrison representing the School of Continuing Education have been chosen to marshal the morning and afternoon ceremonies respectively PERIOD

Fischer is a professor of biological sciences and has been a faculty member since  PERIOD Harrison is an associate professor of art and has been a faculty member since  PERIOD

Faculty marshals have also become a recent tradition for Easterns commencement ceremonies PERIOD Each chosen faculty member will carry the college banner for his or her college during the procession PERIOD

Marty Hackler public functions supervisor said marshals carrying the mace are chosen by fellow colleagues in the college they represent and the faculty marshals are chosen by the dean of their residing college PERIOD

I am completely honored and awed to do this said journalism professor Mary KellyDurkin who is representing the College of Arts and Humanities PERIOD

Tickets are needed for all attending Saturdays commencement ceremony PERIOD Each student graduating is allotted a certain amount of tickets for guests which must be picked up in Old Main by Friday PERIOD Tickets for nongraduating students who wish to attend commencement can pick up tickets late Friday afternoon PERIOD Distribution of tickets depends upon the availability of seating in Lantz Arena PERIOD
